summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons clinical encounter record documenting an injury assessment for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, following an incident in his cell. The report notes he was found with a rope around his neck, shows marks consistent with that, and was placed on suicide watch. The inmate claims he does not know how the injury occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical encounter report, found in his cell with a rope around his neck, assessed for injuries and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Operational Lt.
persons.context: Requested the injury report; custody staff reported finding Epstein in his cell with a rope around his neck.

connections.description: The Operational Lt. requested the medical assessment for Epstein and custody staff under their supervision found him in the cell incident.

events.title: Epstein Cell Incident and Medical Assessment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit Z05-Cell 124) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was assessed for injuries, showed a circular line of erythema on his neck, claimed he did not know what happened, and was placed on suicide watch.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on July 23, 2019, with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor.
Epstein claimed to medical staff he did not know how the injury occurred, stating 'I do not know. Just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting'.

The medical examination revealed a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck, approximately 2 inches wide, covering about two-thirds of the neck circumference, with friction marks in front.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following this incident.
The document records the incident as 'R/O self inflicted injuries' (Rule Out self-inflicted injuries).
